statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 6 \\ -6 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 17 \\ 18 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 47 \\ 49 \\ -9 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 6 \\ -6 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 17 \\ 18 \\ -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 47 \\ 49 \\ -9 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
